alert.note: Alert for Inland Sussex; Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sussex, southwestern Kent, northeastern Talbot, southern Queen Anne`s and central Caroline Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cordova to near Andrewsville. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denton, Harrington, Ridgely, Queen Anne, Matthews, Griffin, Cordova, Andrewsville, Greenwood, Houston, Hillsboro and Farmington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
